intro: Ludwigia hookeri, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along riverbanks, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. Its leaves are opposite and often have a reddish or bronze hue, adding to its ornamental value. Ludwigia hookeri is often cultivated in water gardens and as a pond plant due to its vibrant appearance and adaptability.
